description: Generally feels a lot better on KDE than LibreOffice Writer. Calligra fixes the weird scrolling issues I've had on LibreOffice Writer in KDE, and doesn't have some of the weird display and formatting bugs I've encountered with Libreoffice. Cool, more unique interface than LibreOffice Writer as well. I have noticed I lose bullets on lists when opening word docs, though I haven't worked on figuring out a fix for it.

Sorry for the bad note, but it is really not functional - cannot recommend to any client, or better any SME.
The appearance seems a bit better than LibreOffice or OpenOffice, but hangs on certain settings.
Still there is nothing that matches Microsoft Office - design and functionality.
Maybe there is one that resembles but also limited - Softmaker FreeOffice.
Still there is a long way to dethrone Microsoft.
I myself use heavily a Linux distro, but always fall back on Microsoft Office.
I do not know what the community is waiting for - many of us gave many suggestions about design and functionality, but it fell on deaf ears :-(
Unfortunately there too many missing features or features that do not function. Not useable. It should be laid to rest if it is no logner developed.

The Tools panel is very distortionate to the typing area... it overwhelms what you need to see to do writing - and just a very narrow panel to write it in.

It needs to be more focus on writing, not the tools - until that changes, I won't be using the app.

Cannot see the paper !! ..

but i don't hate it, its just not usable
It's a junk toy. Something to play with if you're bored
unhelpful interface which is too cluttered and the program won't uninstall. This is poor programming ies.and shouldn't be in the repositor

This application looks like it has some useful word processing functions - but:

Not sure what the coding philosophy or usability idea of having the usually ugly part of an application (Settings) own the work space. It is especially a bad idea when most new users to this application will drop it before giving it a chance out of Dockers frustration. These Dockers are hard to use, unmovable, and not intuitive at all. Some times out of no where you are able grab the left edge of the Docker and close it to the right only to have Mr. Docker pop back in place of work space superiority. In other words just plain annoying non intuitiveness. A simple function such as making Mr. Docker disappear with a click might infuse some usability into this application. Or maybe the developers can shows us how they manage Mr. Docker.
summary: Dockers that have their own mind so that you can not use yours

description:
Erster Versuch einer Eingabe: Zeilen löschen: Crash.
Schlechte Karten, wird wieder gelöscht
Cuando me toca escribir una líneas sobre una aplicación de KDE suelo ser redundante. Simple y práctica. Adjetivos que seducen a un usuario minimalisita.

Es imposible no enamorarse del proyecto KDE, sin embargo (y en Calligra en general) siento que falta mejor integración en cuanto formatos MS o Libreoffice. En cuanto a Words, faltan muchas opciones como formato en tablas (es laborioso y confuso) y las barras de herramientas son algo inestables. Sin embargo su calidad es impresionante, entre su facilidad de uso y adaptación, aunque Words necesita mayores funcionalidades.

I'm a fan of OpenDocument, but LibreOffice should not be the only option for people who want to keep the format of their files open. LibreOffice is huge, loads slowly on older machines and has a load of features that most people simply won't need. Additionally, it is not intuitive in any way and does not integrate well for people who prefer KDE such as myself. For those who want a lighter, simpler and more integrated suite, Calligra is the solution. It doesn't get updates as often as LibreOffice does and there is no doubt that it isn't as fully-featured but it also doesn't need to be.
summary: Unbloated and straight to the point

description: Avec Calligra on quitte l'apparence encore très années 90 d'autres suites Office pour Linux. Calligra Words se démarque. Il est agréable à utiliser, intuitif. Les boîtes de navigation reprennent les couleurs du thème (clair, foncé) et celles des icônes, ce qui assure la cohérence avec l'ensemble. Un beau produit. Enfin!
pour désinstaller cela bug aussi avec la malette orange marqué d'un grand A dénomé Unbutu software. la solution dans un terminale sudo apt-get remove calligrawords
Наверное оно работает но невозможно работать с такой огромной панелью справа. Эта панель жутко мешает, а уменьшить ее нельзя.
Панель справа и невозможность ее убрать мешает . Она создает негативное впечатление об этой программе.
Не верил, что нельзя убрать правую панель. Теперь верю. И программа становится бессмысленной. А ведь кто-то затратил на это силы. Не хочу оценивать плохо - всё-таки труд. Но ...
